desc:
The Quest Group is seeking a full time  Data Analyst for one of Atlanta’s fastest growing specialty e-retailers. The position sits in their trendy Midtown office. The selected candidate will support client data integration across the company’s global enterprise and should be able to manage the retrieval, transformation, delivery, and exchange of data between both internal and external business systems across all business units and client base. Provide daily operational production support. This role requires a strong understanding of discipline and should be able to apply knowledge and experience to complex problems and develop recommendations. We are looking for leaders that makes decisions within broad parameters.This person also acts as an informal resource for others with less experience. Someone who works with team members to provide operational support, documentation, and knowledge sharing of best practices.
 
JOB DUTIES: 
Develops strong working relationships with Client Services, Underwriting, Accounting and IT.
Owns operational client data integration
Manages file retrieval and delivery for all client data exchanges using file transfer software—including account administration, host configurations, and job scheduling.
Manages data integration using ETL technology
Understands and conforms to corporate IT data and security standards
Provides feedback from ongoing administration experience to continuously improve the client experience
Responds to eligibility, remittance and deduction questions from various business partners throughout the company
Communicates regarding the impacts and implications of client data integration break points
Performs client platform monitoring and root cause analysis of production incidents.
Leverages tools like Excel or IT-related applications so that operational processing and business targets may be achieved
Manages client file reports for distribution to leaders, team members and business partners
Responds to client inquiries as an additional input to daily workflow for timely resolution
Understands data flows across multiple systems—including storefront, underwriting, billing and financial systems


QUALIFICATIONS: 
Bachelor's or Technical degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics) – 5 plus years of experience required.
Demonstrated problem solving ability with experience in client/customer data management
Hands-on data mining / analytics experience with a service or technology company
Experience in a related operational business process required
Strong Excel and statistical skills required
Experience with at least 1 scripting language is a plus
Experience with Voluntary Benefits Administration is a plus
Experience with Payroll Deduction is a plus
 
COMPENTENCIES: 
Strong analytical skills
Ability to work with a sense of urgency and independence, displaying innovative skills to solve complex problems
Experience with Data Management
Willingness to learn new software applications and workflows related to data management
Demonstrated effective teamwork ability to perform cross-functional operational support
Generates effective solutions based on available information and makes timely decisions
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with IT teams and business users
Understanding of file transfer and ETL technologies
Demonstrates a strong commitment to delivering results while maintaining a secure environment
Strong writing skills to proactively maintain/create documentation

desc:
Data Center Technician contract opening (1 year+) with our client in Pittsburgh, PA.
This position reports to the manager responsible for Data Center Infrastructure Operations with an additional reporting line to the Data Center Facilities Team lead.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Processing cable installation requests, including ensuring requirements are correct such as number and type of connections, port assignments and timing of activity
Interfacing with server, storage and network teams as needed to gather and validate/clarify cabling requirements
Quality testing of all patch cables being used
Supporting troubleshooting issues involving cabling components
Maintaining sufficient inventory of patch cables as described in our DC Standards document
Validating/updating all related work instructions for cabling activities
Participating in the data center oncall rotation which includes; completing daily walk through checklists, incident ticket monitoring, incident resolution monitoring 7x24 for 7 days (current rotation is one week out of every five weeks)
Secondary responsibility is to be fully cross trained for server installations, de-installations and end of lease processing
Take ownership of the inventory management processes; Coordinate efforts of inventory specialists
Coordinates installation/removal of all hardware to/from the data center.
Shipping and receiving duties: Inspects all received hardware shipments; Identifies missing or damaged components; Reports shipment discrepancies to Purchasing or the Lease Administrator


REQUIREMENTS 
5 – 10 years of telecommunications experience within a Data Center environment
Working knowledge of copper (UTP, Cat6, Cat6a) and fiber optic media types, (MMF, SMF, 50 micron, 62.5 micron), industry standards and applications, and use cases (e.g., Ethernet, Fibre Channel)
Significant hands-on experience with the installation of both copper and fiber media types
Expert working knowledge with cable testing systems to ensure operational integrity (pre/post installation)
Expert working knowledge of troubleshooting both copper and fiber cable media. (e.g., dB loss, Attenuation, Breaks, Termination Problems, Transmission Characteristics)
Working knowledge of Fluke test equipment
Understanding of network layouts, Cisco hardware and layer 1 topologies
Working knowledge of Data Center Network Hardware (Ethernet, Fibre Channel interfaces)
Working knowledge of pertinent ISO Standards (ANSI-942, ANSI-568)
Expert working knowledge with Cable Management Systems (e.g., Cabinet, Aerial, Under Floor).
Working knowledge of Visio Software
Excellent customer service skills are a must
PREFERENCES
BICSI Certification strongly preferred
Understanding of RFID technology in a Data Center environment
Experience in server lease end process
Experience using Hardware/Software Request System
Experience using HP Asset Manager software application

Data Center Technician - 15218

desc:
Mental Health Outcomes, a
component of Horizon Health, is the leading company in the design and
implementation of custom outcomes measurement focused solely on behavioral
health programs. Our mission is to support behavioral health care quality for
recipients and providers through clinical outcomes benchmarking.  Mental
Health Outcomes works with a large number of freestanding psychiatric hospitals
and acute care hospital programs nationwide. We achieve our mission through
providing processes, data and analytics/research designed to improve clinical
practice and provide decision makers with the ability to assess the impact of
system changes on outcomes and quality of care. 

Mental Health Outcomes is seeking
a full-time Data Quality Specialist with excellent organization, auditing, and
communication skills. The Data Quality Specialist is responsible for the overall
management of incoming data from customers and monitoring of data
integrity. Primary tasks include tracking incoming data for completeness,
auditing/monitoring/cleaning data to maintain integrity, producing recurring customer
reports as part of a report team, and providing customer support.

The Data Quality Specialist will:


Monitor completeness of incoming data
and timely communicate problems to customers. 


Identify, investigate, and resolve
data discrepancies.


Use SPSS to conduct internal audits
of existing data to maintain integrity.


Audit reports produced by other team
members for anomalies and trends. 


Communicate data concepts and
requirements to customers in user-friendly terms.


Produce and distribute recurring
reports.


Design customer reports, as needed.

Knowledge, skills, and abilities required








Strong organizational skills, problem solving, and critical thinking are required



Significant attention to detail required 



Understanding of relational data



Proficient in independently auditing, cleaning, mining, and interpreting data



Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience with Power Point, Access and SPSS 



Excellent interpersonal/communication skills

label:

Full-Time


Experience - At least 7 year(s)


Telecommunications
desc:
Our client has recently been awarded
structured cabling and infrastructure build-out of multiple Data Centers with a
major technology and social media giant based in Menlo Park, CA. The location
of the first Data Center implementation is New Albany, OH. The Data Center Project Manager will work onsite at the New Albany data
center location and will be responsible for managing all onsite day to day
activities of the data center cabling and infrastructure build. This position
reports directly to the Data Center Program Director, and will be the key
onsite leader to establish and run the New Albany location Data Center project.


The Project Manager’s primary responsibility are:

a) overall leadership,
direction-setting, delegation, and decision making for the onsite Data Center
team, 
b) to be the onsite point of contact to lead the data center project, 
c)
to ensure success of the project by making key decisions and balancing workload,

d) to develop and execute consistent and repeatable runbooks, processes, and
tools, 
e) to be able to track to a Balanced Scorecard with critical KPIs, and

f) to establish and maintain strong relationships with the client leadership
team. This role will include duties for spend reporting, budgeting, strategic
planning, staff development, and business partner relationships.
 
Responsibilities:
Primary Roles & Responsibilities:
Execute North America Commercial Services
(NACS) PMO standards, processes and methodologies in a consistent manner
for project planning and execution activities including: scope definition
and management; task and resource scheduling; cost and price budgeting;
quality review and assurance; client relationship management; project team
management; and overall change management.
Mentor and manage the delivery and
execution of data center project through a balance of best-in-class and
pragmatic project methodologies and practices that achieve KPIs and meet
or exceed business results, client satisfaction and SLAs.
Direct all phases of project from
inception through completion. 
Develop and administer the budgets,
schedules, and technical performance standards. 
Participate in the negotiation of contract
and contract changes. 
Oversee the preparation of proposals,
business plans, proposal work statements and specifications, operating
budgets, and financial terms/conditions of contract. 
Act as primary customer contact for
project activities, leading project review sessions with clients to
discuss overall performance. 
Establish milestones and monitor adherence
to master plans and schedules, identify problems and obtain solutions,
such as allocation of resources or changing contractual
specifications. 
Direct the work of employees assigned to
the project from technical, professional, or administrative areas.
Issue and communicate project status to
leadership, steering committee and other stakeholders as appropriate.
Onboard team members to the program,
facilitating orientation and training on key processes and tools.
Manage project issues/risks in a timely
manner, escalating when necessary.
Foster collaborative working relationships
within NACS operations and across all levels and departments of the
organization to execute program management activities and company
priorities.
Promote continuous growth of project
management practices within the PMO and organization to achieve client and
organizational objectives.
Achieve performance targets established by
leadership for applicable Key Performance Indicators. 
Act as point-of-escalation for the
project.
Manage change control process and scope in
accordance with mutually agreed Change Management process.
Manage Project control fundamentals: 
monitoring, anticipating potential problems, identifying project
conflicts, taking corrective action, resolving issues, managing scope,
schedule, cost, profit and budget, project reporting, quality review and
assurance. Issue and communicate program status to leadership, steering
committee and other stakeholders as appropriate.

Skills & Abilities:
Strong working knowledge of large-scale
(i.e. > 500,000 sq. ft.) data center infrastructure
Strong leadership, decision-making, and
delegation skills are a must.  
Minimum of 10 years Project Management
experience within the technology services industry
Strong working knowledge of both Waterfall
and Agile project management philosophies and the ability to incorporate
both into the project as needed. 
Strong understanding of Earned Value
Management (EVM) and experience in EVM tools, particularly Primavera P6.
Strong decision making and delegation
skills. 
Superior collaboration and communication
skills: team building, conflict resolution, stakeholder management, risk
management, product management, negotiation & decision making, ability
to work and motivate in a team environment and overall change management.
Self-motivated with a strong ability to
plan/organize workloads.
Excellent professional service philosophy
and understanding the challenges in providing superior customer experience
at a national level while controlling costs.
 


Required Education Level:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent, relevant experience

Area of Study / Degree:
BA, Project Management, Engineering, IT or business is desired but not required

Certifications (Required or Preferred):
PMP, RCDD, DCDC desired but not required

Minimum Total Work Experience:
10 years minimum work experience

Minimum Specialized Work Experience:
7+ years’ experience managing large-scale data center implementations
5+ years’ experience working with General Contractors and other trades.
Consulting experience a plus.

desc:
We are seeking a Product Data Analyst to look at the life cycle of our home textile and Lifestyle products.  This data will be presented to help inform key individuals on the performace of different product lines in order to help plan future product lines.  

Primary Responsibility:  
Collect, organize, and analyze product lifecycle data, in order to make data-driven recommendations to drive revenue and profitability. 
Analyze business procedures and recommend specific requirements that will allow product data to be more accurate and accessible.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities: 
Gather, format, and analyze data throughout the product lifecycle.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns using statistical techniques.
Format reports in charts, graphs and tables that easily translate into actionable items.
Monitor product performance, identify improvements, and provide ongoing reports.
Conduct full lifecycle analysis to include data requirements, structure, and design.
Maintain the highest level of accuracy of product data by filtering and cleaning data.
Provide quality assurance of imported data by monitoring master data including creation and updates.

Evaluated On:  
Accuracy and reliability of data reports.
Consistency of product data.
Quality, validity, and credibility of analysis.
Ability to produce actionable recommendations based on data.







Requirements:
Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.
Ability to number crunch large amounts of data using Excel pivot tables and other database applications.
Understanding of basic statistical methods.

This is a full time, on-site position located in Pittsfield, Massachusetts in the beautiful Berkshire Hills and includes an excellent benefit package.  


All interested applicants should forward a cover letter including desired salary level and your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]. 


Why us?  The Annie Selke Companies offers a creative, collaborative work environment in an entrepreneurial company.  Our fresh, fun home textiles have been making waves in the home design industry since 1993, when Annie Selke started the business with an industrial sewing machine on her dining room table. From the very beginning, Annie’s creations have consistently wowed the home décor industry. Each month, her innovative designs and interiors are splashed liberally throughout the pages of top shelter magazines.  Annie’s vibrant, imaginative creations have made the brand synonymous with quality and easy sophistication. An infectious blend of affordability, practicality and terrific design, the product lines are tailor-made for refined, relaxed living.


Learn more about The Annie Selke Companies at www.annieselke.com.

desc:
Immediate need for a talented Data Scientist with experience in the Biotechnology Industry. This is a 12 Months Contract opportunity with long-term potential located in Creve Coeur (St. Louis), MO.  Please review the job description below: 

 
Job ID: 17-18610 


Key Responsibilities: 
 This position is for a Data Scientist to work on operations research and predictive analytics within our client’s Global Supply Chain Analytics team. The responsibilities of this position are the analysis of agricultural data to maximize production quantity and quality, while managing cost, risk and logistics through the development of mathematical optimization, simulation solutions, and scenario modelling. As a Data Scientist, you will also develop strategies to identify new opportunities, expand existing analytical methods, provide insights, and build practical solutions to complex business problems. 

 
Key Requirements and Technology Experience: 
·  M.S (required) or Ph.D. (preferred) in Operations Research, Operations Management, Engineering, Management Science, Mathematics, or another related quantitative discipline. ·  3-5 year's relevant experience delivering stochastic/analytical solutions to complex business problems. ·  Theoretical and practical experience in deterministic optimization and algorithm development related to operations management is a requirement, including experience with commercial optimization software (ex. OPL, GAMS, IBM DOC). ·  Experience with software development and architecture related to operations research, machine learning, geospatial analysis, and artificial intelligence. ·  Expertise in programming and database languages (ex. Python, R, Scala, SQL). ·  Demonstrated experience in optimizing demand, supply, and network flow challenges related to planning, scheduling, space utilization, and customer service levels. ·  Demonstrated problem solving experience analyzing complex data using statistical and advanced analytical methods to deliver predictive and prescriptive insights. ·  Exceptional organizational, interpersonal, and written communication skills. ·  Ability to work in a matrix environment and influence people at varying levels of responsibility. ·  Candidates must demonstrate business aptitude, the ability to rapidly learn new problem domains and become conversant in the domain with business users. 







Must haves:
 ●  Operations Research 70% and Machine Learning 
 ●  Python, R, Scala, SQL 
 ●  Familiar with the Cloud Computing. 
 ●  Must be able to show that they completed a project from beginning to end. 
 ●  Master's degree is required. PhD is preferred. 

 
Desired skills/experience: 
·  Experience in supply chain management, agriculture, and/or laboratory science. ·  Background in big data technologies including Apache Hadoop, Spark and IaaS such as AWS and Google Cloud is highly desirable.
  

 Our client is a leading Biotechnology Industry and we are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions. Qualified candidates should apply online for immediate consideration.

Data Entry and Customer Service Clerk will send out correspondence to current and potential customers, prepare mailings and other materials, file documents, and maintain computer database.

COME GROW WITH US!
Northland Group LLC, a subsidiary of Radius Global Solutions, is currently looking to hire a Data Operations Assistant for our Edina, MN location.
The Data Operations Assistant is responsible for loading client data into processing software, filtering and culling data per client request and search terms, and exporting documents and metadata for review. They are responsible for ensuring the quality of the processed data as well as for making sure that processing resources are utilized effectively and that turnaround requests and deadlines are either met or exceeded.

Perform thorough quality checks on client data and work product at multiple stages of processing to eliminate rework and ensure 100% compliance of data and deliverable to client specification
Make recommendations for improved workflow, quality, internal documentation and processes to maximize system resources and efficiencies as applicable
Assist with training junior team members on department processes and applications, and assist with troubleshooting requests and fixes to deliverables

desc:
ABOUT NEXT COLLEGE STUDENT ATHLETE (NCSA)
NCSA is the world’s largest and most successful collegiate athletic recruiting network. A wholly-owned subsidiary of Reigning Champs (www.reigningchamps.com), NCSA’s team of more than 600 former collegiate and professional athletes leverages 16 years of exclusive data, proprietary matching algorithms, and personal relationships to connect tens of thousands of college-bound student-athletes to more than 41,000 college coaches nationwide across 31 sports every year. You can learn more about NCSA at www.ncsasports.org.
 
Director of Data Science Job Details
We’re looking for someone to lead our Data Science and Analyst team and take our business analytics capabilities to the next level. We need someone who wants to wade in and find the insights even when they might challenge established business patterns and the status quo.  We’re looking for a hands-on leader and innovator who can apply advanced analytics strategically, meet our ever-growing demand for data-driven insights, and help build a stronger product vision along the way.
 
You understand and can implement data processes from collection to modeling to insights. You’re well versed in leading edge practices and technologies including, artificial intelligence, machine learning and deep learning. Ideally, you’ll be as comfortable diving in and getting your hands dirty as leading a strategic initiative and building the team.  You are a self-motivated, organized go-getter who loves taking problems and developing solutions that drive business outcomes.
 
You’ll be working with a collaborative team of analysts and data scientists as well as product managers, designers, developers and business stakeholders across the entire organization. You’ll need to be able to articulate your decisions and take feedback into the next iteration. Want to work with a great team to make students’ lives better? Great!
 
Responsibilities
Establish and improve data collection, engineering, analysis and modeling practices and processes
Support senior management with integrating data science, analytics into decision making and the portfolio of products and services
Provide internal and external thought leadership in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics and visualization
Architect and deliver an enterprise data platform strategy that results in availability of high quality data that satisfies requirements and priorities to achieve business goals
Define and implement strategies for adopting Artificial Intelligence methods across the organization
Participate in strategy and execution for Global Roadmap projects as appropriate
Attract, mentor, manage, and develop data analyst and data scientist talent
Understand and prioritize the data requirements while managing the expectations of stakeholders
Develop, articulate and communicate solutions appropriate to varied business stakeholder audiences


Requirements
3-5 years of relevant experience in similar role with a proven track record of leveraging analytics and large amounts of data to drive significant business impact
Creation/deployment of models & algorithms to analyze unstructured data
Ability to generate relevant insights using data analytics and visualization solutions
Solid understanding of the principles of data management and business process workflow
Experience managing teams of 5 or more people
Experience prioritizing and leading concurrent projects and initiatives
Top notch written and verbal communication skills
 
Preferred Qualifications
Hands-on experience with Artificial Intelligence methods and technologies
Working knowledge of statistics and stats packages like R or Matlab
A scripting language (Python, Ruby, etc.)
SQL and working knowledge of relational databases
Experience with Amazon RedShift and Apache Spark or similar
Self-starter able to make an impact with little guidance 
Extra Credit: former athlete or familiarity with college athletics
 
 
Benefits
Medical, Dental, & Life Insurance
Pre-Tax Flexible Spending Account
401(k) Match Up to 3%
Parental Leave
Wellness Reimbursement Program
Online Health Assessments
 
National Collegiate Scouting Association LLC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, age, disability, sexual and gender orientation, genetic information or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.

with database developers to continually grow and improve our marketing

champion of data – help us build a culture of fact-driven decision

years using SQL in a database environment for reporting and data mining.

with MS Office, especially Excel using advanced formulas.

approach to problem solving.

communication, prioritization and project management skills.

Interested in learning more about Medix’s Pharm Tech Direct (PTD) Program?

desc:
The Defense & Veterans Brain Injury Center (DVBIC) is seeking a Data Associate to participate in TBI research in both the military and veteran population.DVBIC supports a multi-center network of military treatment facilities and Department of Veterans Affairs medical centers. The mission of the Research Division at DVBIC is to support researchers in this network in developing and conducting clinical investigations in traumatic brain injury (TBI). DVBIC’s extensive internal and external collaborations allow for clinical innovation and research along the entire continuum of care of TBI: from initial injury, whether in-theatre or outside of theater, through medical evacuation to acute and post-acute medical settings, rehabilitation, and ultimately a return to family, community and work or continued duty.Position Summary:S/he will plan, conduct, and complete investigations under the supervision of the lead of the project. S/he will participate in all aspects of research including data collection, organization, literature reviews, structured interviews, analysis and interpretation of basic data and will assist with the preparation of technical reports, summaries, and protocols. Primary Responsibilities:Plans, conducts, and completes investigations under the supervision of the head of the project. 
Participates in data collection and organization, literature reviews, structured interviews, provides basic data analysis and interpretation. 
Assists with the preparation of technical reports, summaries, and protocols. 
Maintains clear and accurate records, inventories and logbooks. 
Verifies and corrects data entry for research projects, supports senior staff in quality control and provides trouble shooting. 
Provides written updates to senior staff. 
Additional Responsibilities:                                                                                                                  Understand, update, and instruct staff on Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for hard copy quality assurance (QA), data entry, and data QA, per guidance of the Research Data Coordinator (RDC) and Scientific Directors.
Prepare and improve training materials for hard copy QA, data entry, and data QA and complete secondary QA checks of staff’s finished tasks. 
Assist RDC with cleaning of data and detection of missing data, including identifying, removing, and resolving errors encountered.
Update dataset properties across multiple databases and maintain database merging capability
Construct and QA syntax (under supervision of RDC) written for dataset creation, dataset updates/revision, and data cleaning.
Assist RDC with data export process for data collected electronically, including QA of syntax for import and recoding and troubleshooting PDF/web based errors.
QA of electronic data capture programming (e.g., format design, usability, testing skip patterns, checking data coding, etc.).
Complete checks of existing tracking systems (for recruitment, consent, and questionnaire completion), resolve discrepancies/errors, and create/update formulas for tracking
Note: All DVBIC contract staff working in VA Centers will work as NON-Personal Service contractors.


Knowledge of standard qualitative and quantitative data collection techniques. Ability to follow general instructions; work in a team; good communication, writing and analytical skills; familiarity with social science research methodology is required. Ability to follow detailed instructions. Excellent communication and analytical skills required. S/he must adhere to legal, professional and ethical codes with respect to confidentiality and privacy.
2-4 years’ experience in research required.
Prior experience within the DoD/VA systems of care strongly preferred.
As a trusted systems integrator for more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology provides information technology (IT), systems engineering, professional services and simulation and training to customers in the defense, federal civilian government, health, homeland security, intelligence, state and local government and commercial sectors. With approximately 32,000 professionals worldwide, the company delivers IT enterprise solutions, manages large-scale, mission-critical IT programs and provides mission support services. This position is open as of 10/8/2017.Senior Data Scientist - 50% remote!This is a very unique Data Science opportunity! In this role your time would be split as follows: 2 quarters - teaching at our data science bootcamp in SF, 1 quarter - working on business projects, 1 quarter - you'd get paid to work on data science passion projects of your choice! The latter 2 quarters are REMOTE work.We are a highly successful data science boot-camp with locations in NYC, Chicago, Seattle and San Francisco and we're looking for dynamic Data Scientists with a passion for teaching.Top Reasons to Work with Us- Work remote 2 quarters of each year (with some travel) & get paid to work on passion projects of your choice for 1 quarter!- We are a startup company owned by a global giant so you get the best of both worlds - that startup vibe but with security.- Competitive annual salary and full benefits.What You Will Be DoingSENIOR DATA SCIENTISTWe are looking for Data Scientists to be part of the our Data Science Instructional Team. We seek individuals who love and excel at analyzing and visualizing data to solve important problems, are passionate about teaching others to be premier data scientists, and are fun to be around and work with. An ideal candidate should be quick to learn and adapt, care about design of simple, powerful, beautiful interfaces and visuals, love writing code, thrive in creative team efforts, and also have interests and passions beyond data science.ResponsibilitiesOur Senior Data Scientists provide incredible and inspiring Data Science instruction; support the design and teaching of new products and courses and infuse their expertise into our business operations; and continually sharpen their skills through consulting and passion project explorations. We call this approach our 2-1-1 Instructor Model. Teaching the Data Science Bootcamp (2 quarters of the year)Senior Data Scientists spend half the year co-teaching two 12-week bootcamps (20-24 students). On any given day, the amount of lecture time is 1-2 hours, and the remainder of the day is spent directly engaging with and coaching individually the students.•Leading course discussions•Providing personalized support to students•Improving the quality of our curriculum •Offering career guidance and interview supportDeveloping and Teaching New Courses and Supporting Business Operations (1 quarter of the year)Senior Data Scientists spend about one-quarter of the year helping to create and teach new course offerings, as well as infusing our functional areas – admissions, marketing, careers, instructor recruitment – with their domain expertise.•Creating new courses and/or enhancing existing courses•Providing data science training to corporations•Interviewing and providing feedback on applicants•Speaking at events and conferences•Writing articles and blogs•Assisting with instructor recruitmentSharpening Skills and Pursuing Data Science Passion Projects (1 quarter of the year)Senior Data Scientists spend about one-quarter of the year focused entirely on enhancing their skill set and building their data science knowledge in whatever way they choose. These three months are intended to be self-driven. Some ideas include:•Consulting on pro bono data science projects (e.g., with DataKind)•Providing in-house data science project expertise to specific companies•Authoring a book related to data science•Enrolling in data science classes•Working on open source passion projectsWhat You Need for this PositionMust haves:Machine Learning AlgorithmsSolid Python experience 2+ years INDUSTRY experience of data science A passion for teachingPreferred (NOT essential):Ideally Masters or PhD in quantitative fieldPrior teaching experienceWhat's In It for YouPerks of the Role•Part of a team that is transforming education•Three paid months per year to sharpen skills and pursue passion projects•Competitive compensation package•Opportunity to network and develop, both among our internal Data Science speaker community, as well as through our parent company which is a global organization•Opportunity to work in different geographic locations if desiredSo, if you are a Data Scientist who wants to teach, get involved in the business AND get paid to spend 3 months a year working on a data science project of your choice, please apply today!Required SkillsData Science, Python, scikit.learn, Virtual Environments, Bayesian Inference, Machine Learning Algorithms, teaching experienceIf you are a good fit for the Senior Data Scientist - 50% remote! desc: About Us:We are a private mortgage insurer with $184.3 billion primary insurance in force covering approximately one million mortgages (as of April 30, 2017.) MGIC provides a critical component of our country’s residential mortgage finance system, protecting mortgage investors from credit losses. Mortgage insurance from MGIC also benefits consumers by making affordable low-down-payment mortgages a reality. Bottom line…We put people into homes sooner! #WeAreMGICA day in the life of our Data Architect: The Data Architect provides Data Modeling and Data Management expertise to achieve business outcomes as a member of the Data & Analytics team.Under the direction of Enterprise Information Architect, the Data Architect contributes to the definition of standards, policies, and procedures for MGIC, in alignment with industry standards and best practices. The Data Architect contributes to analysis, planning, and solution design. They ensure solution designs and data models adhere to standards for business requirements as well as maintainability, extensibility, and security. As a project team member, the Data Architect creates and maintains conceptual, logical, and physical data models to meet business outcomes. They maintain reference data, metadata, and technical and non-technical documentation as required. The Data Architect participates as needed for other areas including validation, testing, and troubleshooting, including off-hours support if needed.What’s in it for you?•Competitive Salary & Benefits•Profit Sharing•401(k) with a company match•Pension Plan•On-site Fitness Center and Classes (corporate office)•Paid-time off and paid company holidays•Paid Parental Leave•Tuition reimbursementWhat we’re looking for: •Requirements include a Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in Information Systems. Additional years of related work experience may be substituted for education beyond an Associate Degree. ••Expertise in data modeling and data management is required for the Data Architect candidate. This includes demonstrated experience with normalized industry data models (e.g. party model), dimensional data models, and data modeling best practices to meet operational, master data, warehousing, big data, and BI needs. ••Strong proficiency with SQL and tools for data modeling, metadata management, and data management is required. Technical familiarity with ETL, data services, and hadoop is preferred. ••Experience working on Agile project teams, applying Agile tenets to data modeling and design is required.••The Data Architect candidate is versatile team player, focusing on achieving outcomes through teaming and collaboration. ••Exceptional written and verbal communication is a must, with a demonstrated ability to express technical concepts to a non-technical audience.A little more about us!Our headquarters are located in downtown Milwaukee, a place that offers something for everyone with its big-city attractions and small-town atmosphere. MGIC is a seven time recipient of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel Top Work Places award. This is an award based on the opinion of our company's greatest asset, our talented and dedicated workforce! title: Senior Data Scientist - Eden Prairie, MN or Telecommute
label:
Job Snapshot



Full-Time


Healthcare - Health Services


Health Care
desc:
We're changing the way health care works for the better. That means consulting with our members, partnering with our physicians, and delivering drugs in the most efficient and effective way. Join us and start doing your life's best work.(sm) 

We are currently looking for a Sr. Data Scientist to join our team to work alongside like-minded Principal Data Scientists on the development and delivery of large and complex predictive modeling projects for healthcare Payment Integrity claim/case/membership detection.  This individual works with operations or business analysts to identify the project requirements and the expected outcome.  They team up with fellow Data Scientists to discover business insights, identify opportunities, and provide solutions and recommendations to solve business problems through the use of statistical, algorithmic, data mining and visualization techniques.  In addition to advanced analytic skills, this Sr. Data Scientist is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database and computing environments, and communicating results.

Primary Responsibilities:
Apply advanced statistical and predictive modeling techniques to build, maintain, and improve on multiple predictive detection engines in Advanced Analytics Labs

Lead discovery processes with fellow Sr. Data Scientists and Principal Data Scientists and partner with Payment Integrity Operation management to identify the business requirements and the expected outcomes

Create and provide sound statistical analyses and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions

Collaborates with data stewards to gather information to be used for analytics and predictive model building purposes and to ensure the data meets the qualifications and assurance requirements of the analyses

Design sampling methodology, prepare data, including data cleaning, univariate analysis, missing value imputation, etc., identify appropriate analytic and statistical methodology, develop predictive models and document process and results

Communicate analytics results and predictive models to business partners and clients

Provide on-going tracking and monitoring of performance of statistical models and recommends ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information
Required Qualifications:
Masters or Ph.D. degree in Data Science, (bio) statistics, applied statistics, applied mathematics, economics, or similar quantitative fields of study

5+ years of experience of hands-on modeling skills and strong analytic programming skills using SAS tools, including SAS/BASE, SAS/STAT, and SAS Enterprise Guide 

2+ years of SAS Enterprise Miner

5+ years of experience manipulating large datasets and using databases

Self-motivated, capable to grasp analytical concepts and clearly understand how analytical solutions can help customers reduce their healthcare claim costs

Demonstrable ability to quickly understand new concepts-all the way down to the theorems- and to come out with original solutions to mathematical issues
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years demonstrated experience in the following Big Data and Machine Learning technologies
R, Python, Java, or Scala languages

Spark ML, Scikit-learn, H2O, TensorFlow, or related ML libraries  

Adaptable & experienced in converting SAS-based models to R, Python, or related open source

Working knowledge and understanding of medical coding, including ICD, CPT, DRG, etc.

Experience with health care claims data and Payment Integrity processes highly preferred
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

desc:
Our client is currently seeking a Sr. Data Architect 
*This is a long term contract, candidates can work on a W2 or 1099 basis. 
This role will be responsible for designing, creating, deploying and managing the organization's data architecture by defining how the data will be stored, consumed, integrated and managed by different data entities and IT systems, as well as any applications using or processing that data in some way in support of the organization's strategic initiatives.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
1.            Design and create the physical data model for the data warehouse by analyzing the data from all source system applications.
2.            Create and maintain source to target mappings between the source system applications and the data warehouse, including business logic and data quality rules.  This includes working with the source system application development teams to ensure the application databases follow appropriate data architecture principles.
3.            Provide a standard common business vocabulary,  maintain the data lineage documentation and champion the maintenance of the business glossary by the data stewards.
4.            Own the Enterprise Business Domain Model (BDM) – this company's Business Language- and be responsible for the agile evolution of the model to enable the implementation of the intended business architecture. Develop and socialize data architecture principles to ensure their adoption by the application development teams.
5.            Build relationships with business stakeholders and partners to understand information needs.
Job Specifications:
Knowledge:
•             Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management required.
•             8-10 years of Data/Information Architecture experience, with 5+ years of consistent record of contribution, leadership and impact to the technology.
•             Experience delivering complex software systems through all phases of a software delivery lifecycle.
•             Experience across all phases of data modeling, from conceptualization to database optimization.
•             Experience providing direction, strategy and value by analyzing current and future states of data, setting and communicating standards, and conception of projects or features to close the gap between current state and future goals.
•             Excellent communication skills with significant experience in developing executive level customer relationships, including solid negotiation, influencing, presentation and communication skills at C and executive levels.
•             Successful track record in following through on both plans and communication of those plans with business and IT leaders.
•             Experience with Guidewire's Policy Center and Billing Center strongly preferred.
•             Experience in the financial/insurance industry, preferred.
•             Proven ability to influence at multiple levels with an organization.
•             Experience with Cloud Computing and Big Data preferred.
•             Experience in Information Technology (IT) working on large complex $MM applications development and ITO projects.
Skills and Abilities:
•             Create and maintain the physical data model for the Enterprise Data Warehouse to ensure accurate data consumption.
•             Own the Enterprise Business Domain Model - and be responsible for the agile evolution of the model to enable the implementation of the intended business architecture.
•             Identify and utilize data architectural patterns that are aligned to business enterprise architecture, leverage common solutions and services, and meet financial targets (cost and benefits).
•             Participate in the data governance process as a member of the enterprise data council.
•             Build relationships with business stakeholders and partners to understand information needs. 
•             Define enterprise information strategy and roadmap that aligns with corporate goals.
•             Design and implement the process for integrating data design and implementation into this company's Agile Process.
•             Partner with Business Agile Teams to provide early stage domain modeling services, support, and mentoring to leverage business domain modeling practices and incorporate domain language usage in produced Agile artifacts.
•             Partner with Implementation Agile Teams to provide support and mentoring to facilitate adherence to the enterprise data strategy and ensure BDM traceability.
•             Direct the evolution of the metadata strategy to provide accessibility to the Business Domain Language and traceability to its logical and physical manifestation in enterprise applications and Business Intelligence.
•             Partner with Business Agile Teams to establish a process that provides early stage user interface prototyping  support and mentoring to consistently capture interaction requirements.
•             Partner with Implementation Agile Teams to provide support and mentoring to incorporate information architecture and make sure that the resulting user experience reflects the customer's needs and consistently presents information in the business domain language.
•             Provide a Community of Practice for Agile Team members to provide a good understanding of model information structures, data gathering requirements, user needs and behaviors,  and labeling techniques.

title: People Data Scientist (Temp, Benefits-Eligible)
label:

desc:
This role is temporary, estimated for six months with benefits.

At Terumo BCT (TBCT), we are working to use data to inspire our decision making more thoroughly, and our People Reporting and Analytics function at TBCT uses analytical approaches to help make TBCT a great place to work.

As a People Data Scientist, you'll help us analyze our people data better to support insights at scale. You are detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. Most of all, you're someone who wonders 'Why?' This is an ideal role for individual with broad-based, generalist-type human resources experience hoping to grow in the people reporting, benchmarking, analytics, and/or workforce planning spaces, or a Data Science and Business Intelligence professional hoping to learn more about human capital management. Excellent growth opportunity for the right candidate.

This role will ultimately play a critical role in helping our global Associate & Organizaitonal Effectiveness (Human Resources) team address the data-related needs of their clients across the globe by automating existing reporting to better serve repeated, predictable business needs. You'll work in partnership with cross-functional partners globally to ensure data automations meet customer needs.

Our ideal candidate prides themselves on excellent follow through, accountability, and documentation. Must be able to navigate ambiguity, balance competing priorities, and escalate concerns as appropriate. Customer- centric disposition and the tendency to over-communicate outcomes and processes are ideal.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES
Assists with the architecture, development, and automation of data solutions, iteratively building and prototyping reports and dashboards to begin to enable insights at scale.
Builds queries to business specifications and conforming to established best practice definitions;
Manipulates and analyzes large data sets, connect disparate ideas into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations using creative, structured and analytical thinking;
Participates in and curates content for quarterly people reporting products review;
Helps to ensure that all report distribution conforms to security and privacy models;
Supports and participates in people data governance processes;
Reviews people data periodically with business users to ensure accuracy;
Creates effective, scalable reporting solutions (e.g. columnar reports and benchmarking dashboards).
Prioritizes work to manage multiple workstreams, high pressure situations, and new information.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS

Education
Bachelor’s degree with studies in analytics, data science, information technology, statistics, finance, or a related field, or equivalent experience.

Experience
Minimum 3 Years of experience in data science, business intelligence, human resources, management consulting, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Skills
Experience using Alteryx or other ETL automation software highly desirable.
Experience using SQL, Python or other data or scripting language.
Must have proficiency with Excel.
Thorough understanding of data science process and data discovery processes.
Experience building and maintaining a solution to collect, store, and organize data to address client needs.
Ability to perform and script algebraic-style calculations and queries.
Experience using data visualizations to communicate trends (e.g., tables, charts, graphs);
Experience with conducting research using basic statistics (e.g., correlations, t-tests, regressions)
Previous use of visualization software (Tableau, Qlick, Microsoft BI, Domo, etc.) preferred.

OR
An equivalent competency level acquired through a variation of these qualifications may be considered.

For more information, please contact Jessie at  303 542-5219 or [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Typical Office Environment requirements include: reading, speaking, hearing, close vision, walking, bending, sitting, and occasional lifting up to 20 pounds.
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the essential duties of this job. 
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Affirmative Action Employer.  All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, order of protection status, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, military status or an unfavorable discharge from military service.

We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing and background verification checks.  As of January 1, 2017 the Terumo BCT Lakewood, Colorado location will be a tobacco-free workplace. For more information about Terumo BCT, visit our website www.terumobct.com/careers.
Join Terumo BCT as we unlock the potential of blood. We are a global leader in blood component and cellular technologies, and the only company with the unique combination of apheresis collections, manual and automated whole blood processing, and pathogen reduction coupled with leading technologies in therapeutic apheresis and cell processing. We believe in the potential of blood to do even more for patients than it does today. This belief inspires our innovation and strengthens our collaboration with customers.

As the largest medical device manufacturing company headquartered in Colorado, we are home to more than 2,300 associates and our products are in use in more than 125 countries and territories. desc:
Are you passionate about improving the quality of healthcare? 
Are you interested in exploring a rapidly expanding universe of clinical data? 
Are you ready to leverage your talents to make healthcare better for everyone? 
Are you fascinated by the growing field of data science?
Then join the new Data Science & Advanced Analytics team at Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG) that is transforming the delivery of healthcare in the United States!
HSAG has been a pioneer in the field of healthcare quality improvement for over three decades, serving approximately:
25 percent of the nation’s Medicare population
46 percent of the nation’s Medicaid population
20 percent of the nation’s dialysis population
HSAG is nationally recognized as an industry leader in the areas of data analysis, measure development, and patient satisfaction surveys. We are in search of talented individuals that are interested in a career in analytics as an Analyst in HSAG’s Data Science & Advanced Analytics division. Together we can spread positive change to make healthcare better.  
UNIQUE BENEFITS
The Analyst also benefits from HSAG’s desire to grow its staff into the future leaders of healthcare quality improvement in the nation. New HSAG analysts are provided formal training in statistics, clinical epidemiology, SAS, healthcare data, and an assortment of healthcare-related topics. 
HSAG offers:
A comfortable work-life balance, including half-day Fridays and flexible work schedules.
Three weeks of paid time off and 13 company-paid holidays where staff leave two hours early prior to each holiday just to get a “jump start” on holiday festivities.
HSAG offers a competitive benefit package which includes, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) and an employee stock ownership plan. 
DESCRIPTION
The Analyst is a key contributor to cutting edge analytic work that spans the broad spectrum of healthcare data projects at HSAG. Driven by intellectual curiosity and a passion for healthcare quality, the Analyst develops and executes innovative analytic plans that are intended to provide healthcare decision and policy makers with the necessary information to transform healthcare. The Analyst will also assist in designing a wide array of analytic studies and participate in all phases of the research design process. The Analyst will have at his or her fingertips a wide array of data types to facilitate data exploration, including:
survey
case review
medical and prescription drug claims
eligibility
clinical
electronic health record
operational
Details regarding potential project assignments will be discussed with potential candidates during the interview process.
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Serve as an integral part of HSAG Data Science & Advanced Analytics division.
Understand primary types of healthcare data and methods for approaching data assessments.
Evaluate a wide array of data types.
Conduct and interpret analyses, develop appropriate statistical models, manipulate complex databases, and track and evaluate patterns of care and outcomes.
Perform data validation, conduct analysis plans, and cross reference data.
Attend and participates in team training meetings.
Present and communicate project results to non-analytic staff members and customers. 
Represent HSAG in a professional manner at all times.

The primary responsibility will be to drive the design and implementation of a global product data model for Simpson as well as to define the data flow of the product data between our major information systems. This work will include identifying existing data sources, determining systems of record, as well as designing new data stores. The ideal candidate has a background in database design, will understand how to design normalized data structures, how to identify and design the relationships between data elements, and will also have solid business analyst skills  being able to understand and capture business requirements, listen, and push back as needed to come to a practical, sustainable design. A background in structural engineering background is also highly desirable. This role is NOT a data scientist or Big Data role, although these skillsets would be helpful, the scope of the work does not include a big data use case. The Data Architect will work directly with Business stakeholders and Subject Matter experts within the Engineering, Marketing, Sales, and IT organizations. He/she will be responsible to requirements gathering, design, and working with the IT Business Intelligence team to implement the data architecture for our product model as well as other data models within our client.


50% Analyze business and functional requirements related to Simpson's product data model as well as other major data models for Simpson Strong-Tie. Develop the data model design and drives the implementation of the data model and related BI structures, data flows, and data governance processes. Work with business stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand the data requirements and work with the IT Business Intelligence team to build the data structures. Reviews and communicates all final designs to business and IT stakeholders, and ensures that we have buy-in from all appropriate stakeholders. Ensures that documentation is kept up to date and available to stakeholders. Maintain data flows and data location documentation for GDPR compliance. 20% Drives the data model implementation with the IT Business intelligence team, and will act in the role of project manager for data structure builds. Will drive day to day project management tasks, report progress and issues to management, and will ensure that all aspects of the data model project are met including design, development, communication, training, integrations, and cutover. 10% Works with external partners and vendor organizations as needed to deliver on objectives. label:

Computer Software


Engineering, Information Technology
desc:
The position will be responsible for working with the EPA Exchange Network grant to implement the surface water tracking system (ATTAINS) data exchange and update an existing water quality data exchange.  In order to achieve the data exchanges, this position will be responsible for developing, testing, and implementing the migration of data from the DNR/Environmental Protection Division (EPD) source systems to EPA defined staging tables through various database objects and ETL routines in a SQL Server environment.
 
The candidate can be expected to perform the following (but not limited to):
Update and integrate EPD’s internal databases via an Exchange Network data flow with federal databases
 Implement EPA's newly redesigned national data exchange flow configuration for required reporting of surface water assessment (ATTAINS) results
Update the EPD’s Water Quality Exchange (WQX) schema to utilize the most recent version that supports raw data flows

Utilize the EPD account of the Virtual Exchange Service Administrator (VESA) web portal to deliver the staged data to the federal databases. This will require coordination with the EPA managed VESA administrators and support staff. 
Test and troubleshoot web services that instantaneously link to EPD's datasets to promote transparency and customer service support

 
The role includes writing high-level SQL queries, writing scripts for computer automation, documenting decisions, quality assurance/control, IT infrastructure integration, and data management support. The position will be instrumental in maintaining effective communication and coordination among project team members and external partners, including participation in coordination, tracking, and reporting.
 
Percent of time performing various duties:
40% - Assist in designing data flow procedures between EPD and external systems. Format and validate data, prepare databases, evaluate flows (quality assurance/quality control; QA/QC), and document procedures. Collaborate with technical programming staff to automate processes or fulfill other programming needs.
 
40% - Help prepare various raw datasets for upload to databases, assist in QA/QC process, and generate automated reports based upon the data. Manage and display data or results in various spatial viewers and web pages.
 
20% - Project coordination: Set up and facilitate meetings among technical and program staff to document progress towards project goals. Assist with data and progress reports for submittal to EPA.


This role requires knowledge of new technologies including web services, map services, Exchange Network protocols, and object-relational database management systems. Ideal candidate will have the ability to work independently with little supervision, as well as with an integrated team. Excellent skills in problem-solving, collaboration, and communication including speaking, writing, and listening are needed.
 
Candidate should possess superior organization skills and attention to detail. Proficiency is needed in Microsoft Office, especially Access and Excel. Experience processing and maintaining large volumes of data, stored procedures, and functions is a must.
 
An ideal candidate has some combination of education or experience among the following: Data systems design, analysis, development, documentation, testing, debugging, and deployment.

BNED LoudCloud is looking for an exceptional senior data scientist in NYC. This is a unique opportunity to join a new, multidisciplinary team of creative and passionate individuals who are passionate about making a difference in higher education.
BNED LoudCloud’s flagship analytics suite of products and services – LoudSight - leverages sophisticated predictive modeling techniques on historical student information to predict and deliver insights on student retention and persistence. You will lead the efforts to build, advocate, evangelize data-fueled products that help our customers improve student retention and persistence. You’ll dig in and become an expert on our student information and engagement datasets. Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)

Additionally, this position develops/proposes strategies within Data Management and collaborates cross-functionally to ensure successful outcomes for projects/studies. This position has strong knowledge of Electronic Data Capture/related applications and industry standards, and strong skills in working with data received from CROs and other third party vendors. This position has solid verbal/written skills, analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skills and works effectively with people at different levels and from different disciplines and cultures. Additionally, this position possesses advanced knowledge of clinical operations and processes and relevant regulatory requirements. This position has experience working on Phase I-IV study studies within the medical device and/or pharmaceutical industry across multiple therapeutic areas and experience with regulatory submissions and inspections. Finally, this position has strong skills in continuous improvement, project management, change management, and risk management.ResponsibilitiesLeadership, Direction, and Strategy: Establishes Data Management strategy at the project and/or study level for a larger number of projects/studies with greater complexity. 
Leads functional and/or multidisciplinary teams working on projects/studies and/or initiatives.

Provides oversight for Data Management CRO and other third party vendors to ensure compliance with the protocol, external/internal standards, Good Clinical Practices (GCPs), applicable regulatory guidelines, Policies, SOPs, and other relevant guidelines. 
Ensures Data Management deliverables meet/exceed project/study team expectations regarding quality, time, and cost and that Data Management documentation is filed/archived according to applicable Daiichi Sankyo and regulatory requirements.
Functional Expertise: Reviews/approves clinical study related documents that are owned by other functions (e.g., Protocols, Statistical Analysis Plans, Clinical Study Reports).
Actively participates in audits and inspections.
Operational Efficiency / Continuous Improvement: Provides leadership within Data Management by partnering with internal and external stakeholders to optimize Data Management technology, processes, and standards (improving quality/inspection readiness, decreasing cycle times, and reducing costs). 
Leads multidisciplinary process improvement initiatives. 
Leverages comprehensive Data Management expertise to promote best practices across the Clinical Trial lifecycle.

location: 3133 E Camelback Rd, Phoenix, AZ, USA
label:

Full-Time


Healthcare - Health Services


Management
desc:
Are you interested in exploring a rapidly expanding universe of clinical data? 
Are you ready to leverage your data management skills to make healthcare better for everyone? 
Then join the new Data Science & Advanced Analytics team at Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG) that is transforming the delivery of healthcare in the United States!
HSAG has been a pioneer in the field of healthcare quality improvement for over three decades, serving approximately:
25 percent of the nation’s Medicare population
46 percent of the nation’s Medicaid population
20 percent of the nation’s dialysis population
HSAG is in search of talented individuals that are interested in joining HSAG as a Data Specialist. Together we can spread positive change to transform healthcare.  
UNIQUE BENEFITS
Beyond exciting work that is shaping healthcare quality in the United States, HSAG offers:
A comfortable work-life balance, including half-day Fridays and flexible work schedules.
Three weeks of paid time off and 13 company-paid holidays where staff leave two hours early prior to each holiday just to get a “jump start” on holiday festivities.
HSAG offers a competitive benefit package which includes, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) and an employee stock ownership plan.
DESCRIPTION
The Data Specialist is a key contributor to cutting edge data management work that spans the broad spectrum of healthcare data projects at HSAG. The Data Specialist will support extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, testing and validation of processed data, and tracking and reporting testing results in support of HSAG activities. This position is responsible for working with the Data Science & Advanced Analytics (DSAA) team, and clients to achieve corporate, department, and project goals and objectives. Primary duties include data collection, processing, initial validation, document creation and maintenance, in addition to notification management. Duties would also include the development of project work plans, project documentation, and technical writing as needed. The Data Specialist acts as an internal and external liaison for data management and support activities by monitoring data status and customer issues, and providing technical assistance. This individual represents the company as needed at planning, training, and implementation meetings with assigned clients.
ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Under the direction of the DSAA Data Management Director, develop, improve, and implement solutions and documentation related to data management activities currently in use and to be developed in support of HSAG activities.
Prepare and deliver documentation and technical support to corporate staff and HSAG clients, managed care organizations, and their contractors regarding data gathering or dissemination activities.
Document internal policies, procedures, and quality control processes that ensure complete, accurate, and secure data is available for applications and DSAA analysts.
Document internal policies, procedures, and quality control processes that ensure complete, accurate, and secure data meet customer requirements.
Research customer issues, and provide data support services.
Participate in User Acceptance Testing process.
Responsible for documentation related to key deliverables and support documentation for assigned contracts and projects.
Accountable for ensuring completion of assigned tasks according to contract specifications and ensuring that completed tasks meet client and budget requirements.
Provide testing, documentation, and support for the database and project design, data collection and management, monitoring, and report preparation for assigned projects.
Assure timely and high quality contract deliverables, and be accountable for the development and adherence to project time and task schedules for assigned projects.
Troubleshoot with other HSAG departments on project activities, when necessary.
Maintain flexibility to assist and support all department activities as necessary.
Act as a contact for the data management and documentation support.
Keep abreast of changes in testing technologies and environments, database structures and current analytic methodologies, and communicate this information to peers and others within the company.

This role will also serve as subject matter expert on data quality proactive alerts as well as associated data quality tools and processes. Candidates should have in depth experience working with end users, developers, and other analysts to refine identified business needs through design reviews and information sessions. Candidates should be results driven, detailed orientated and work well within a global, dynamic and creative team. This candidate should have experience working in an AGILE environment. Experience with large data sets, specifically clinical data, what it looks like, what it means and how it’s used, is highly desirable.

Collaborate with Global IT Solutions functional groups by adhering to established processes to ensure that business requirements are delivered through successful project implementation of optimal, cost-effective solutions
Collaborate with project team to ensure timely delivery and quality of all project deliverables
